"Stop Circuit Laundry" campaign launched on campus

By Gracie Daw

The campaign has over 500 signatures from students and demands that the University of York end their contract with Circuit Laundry

Open Letter sent to the Vice Chancellor arguing against pay cut for marking boycott

By James Clay

York academics and students respond to pay cut for staff participating in marking boycott

Nouse interviews students standing as candidates for the local council

By James Clay

Student council candidates share their thoughts in the run up to the local elections

York set for 2023 local council elections

By James Clay

Lib Dems and Labour battle it out to take overall majority control of the City of York Council.

Labour gain control of the council after winning local elections

By James Clay

A disappointing night for the Lib Dems and Greens in York as Labour reach a majority of council seats

University announces death of Long Boi

By Gracie Daw

The University released a statement on the Radio 1 Breakfast show saying they were "forced to conclude he has passed away"

University announces death of Long Boi

By Gracie Daw

The University released a statement on the Radio 1 Breakfast show saying they were "forced to conclude he has passed away"

Fairfax House petition for compensation

Students in Fairfax House, Vanbrugh College, are petitioning the University for a partial refund as a result of the substandard accommodation they believe they have received (Thumbnail credit Students in Fairfax claim they have been overcharged for their rooms. Photo: Peter Iveson)

How green is York?

Martin Spurr looks at how sustainable the University is and what improvements are being undertaken

YUSU shortlisted for NUS Award

It has been announced that YUSU have been shortlisted in the 2011 NUS Awards, for the Endsleigh Technology Innovation Award (Thumbnail credit Credit: NUS)

Karin Diaconu elected GSA President

Karin Diaconu has been elected as the new President of the Graduate Student Association (Thumbnail credit Credit: GSA)

York continues to drop in 'Green League' rankings

The University of York has been ranked 83rd in the 2011 People and Planet Green League out of 142 universities for its environment and ethics performance. (Thumbnail credit Credit: People and Planet)

Inquest rules drugs as cause of student death

An inquest into the death of a University of York student this week has concluded that he died because of a dependency on drugs (Thumbnail credit James Matthews )

York graduate prospects plummet

With national graduate employment research indicating a 33 per cent increase in graduate job applications this year, it is feared this will have a detrimental affect on the already poor graduate employment statistics at York (Thumbnail credit The careers service faces criticsism as York graduates struggle for jobs)

Students start up ethical campus shop

A group of students have started up Scoop, a food cooperative on campus, selling a variety of grocery items such as locally sourced organic vegetable boxes

Biology students described as "guinea pigs" in course changes

First-year Biology students have criticised the way the new Biology course has been set up, with the majority of the module being examined in the space of four days (Thumbnail credit Biology students have not been happy with the way the department's new first year course has been structured. Photo: University of York)

Future of Societies Committee in question

The newly-formed societies committee has been left completely empty after no students ran for any positions on the committee (Thumbnail credit Societies committee may have to be revised as no students have run for any of the eight roles up for election. Photo: Howard Russell)

College chairs' relationship with University strained

Several college JCRC chairs have spoken out against the University for its lack of communication with the student representatives at college level and the way it has managed their problems (Thumbnail credit Many colleges have had confrontations with the University over the price of drinks and success of the bars. Photo: University of York)

College funds suffer without Grenville grant

College JCRCs have been left without cash after an PS800 a term grant was not available in the first two and a half terms of this year due to a "technical fault" (Thumbnail credit Club D events were indirectly affected by the lack of the Grenville fund. Photo source: Facebook)

York arms trade campaign retract petition after possible legal action

The York Campaign Against the Arms Trade have been advised to withdraw a petition which they launched against the University over comments about BAE Systems (Thumbnail credit Students have protest against arms company BAE systems across the UK. Photo: CAAT)

University to increase overseas student intake

The number of overseas students attending York will increase by 13.4 per cent over the next four years which will see the proportion of international students as a percentage of the student body rise

Catered accommodation prices to drastically rise

On campus accommodation fees are set to rise by five per cent next year, across all rent bands, with catered accommodation seeing a dramatic increase (Thumbnail credit Students in the Derwent and Langwith colleges next year will be paying PS10 per week more for meals in D-bar)

York at the bottom of university sex survey

Students at the University of York have ended up at the bottom of the league for the average number of sexual partners they have had at university (Thumbnail credit York was ranked in the bottom three for the average number of sexual partners at universities across the UK. Photo credit: New Batteries)

New ISA committee results announced

The results of this year's International Student Association (ISA) elections have been announced with Lewis Yingwei Chen beating En Shi Teoh to become the new committee Vice-President (Thumbnail credit Chen was elected Vice-President. Photo source: Facebook)

Students' rent collection failure

The collection of 2400 students' rent and some students' tuition fees by the University has been delayed for the second time this academic year, for students who are part of the direct debit scheme (Thumbnail credit Accommodation fees have not been collected on time for a second term. Photo: aldisley)

First-year History students left confused after inconsistent departmental advice

First-year History students were left confused a day before their first exam on Monday, after their department sent a series of contradictory emails about referencing in their examination (Thumbnail credit Professor Bill Sheils, Head of the History Department, has acknowledged the departmental mistakes. Image credit: University of York)

Students demonstrate over ties with arms companies

Students protested against the University's choice of research funding outside Vanbrugh College today and urged it to introduce new ethical funding legislation (Thumbnail credit Image credit: Philippa Grafton)

Full Summer Ball line-up unveiled

A second set of acts have been announced for the Summer Ball with Nero and The Subways completing the line-up for this year, after Dionne Bromfield and Darwin Deez were revealed last week

Referendum on NUS affiliation sparks debate

Susan Nash, NUS Vice President Society and Citizenship, has defended YUSU's affiliation with the National Union of Students (NUS) stressing that "unity is strength" when speaking at the UGM on Thursday

University of York drops six places in Guardian league table

York have fallen out of the top ten and into 15th place in this year's <em>Guardian </em>university league tables.

York miss out on early Roses win as darts descends into chaos

Disgraceful scenes erupted at the Darts this evening as York sought to win Roses. With the game poised it was abandoned after a pint of beer was thrown at electricals (Thumbnail credit The game concluded on Derwent bar's smaller darts board. Photo: Philippa Grafton)

Cigarette fire causes JBM library evacuation

Students in the library were disrupted today as one of the buildings was evacuated after a cigarette caused a fire outside on the embankment (Thumbnail credit Credit: Peter Iveson)

First Summer Ball acts announced

The first two acts for the Summer Ball this year have been announced as Dionne Bromfield and Darwin Deez

Free LFA classes suffer 47 per cent dropout rate with first-year students

The free Languages for All (LFA) classes for first-year students looks set to be reviewed after <em>Nouse</em> has revealed almost half of first-years have attended their class five times or fewer (Thumbnail credit Nearly half of first-year students have stopped attending their LFA class despite the University waiving the fee. Photo credit: Lucy Dixon)

More PhD students to take on teaching roles

Departments at York are planning to hire more PhD students, rather than permanent staff, as a budgeting measure in the face of a future reduction in the teaching grant distributed by the government (Thumbnail credit PhD students used in Economics. Photo credit: University of York)

York Rugby team's behaviour questioned during Easter tour

The rugby team have come under pressure following criticism of their behaviour whilst on tour at Saloufest during the Easter break (Thumbnail credit Saloufest is a five day sports-party event which the rugby team attended. Image source: Facebook)

Lack of online voting for RAG elections criticised

This year's RAG Committee elections has faced criticism from the candidates as the voting system was by paper ballot only, and not all were fully aware of the election rules

Students in Fairfax House, Vanbrugh College, are petitioning the University for a partial refund as a result of the substandard accommodation they believe they have received (Thumbnail credit Students in Fairfax claim they have been overcharged for their rooms. Photo: Peter Iveson)
